enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Reserved for Materials Science majors
title: MEAS MAT_SCI 351-2-20 Introductory Physics of Materials

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This is the second part of a two-course sequence. In this quarter, the quantum mechanical and statistical concepts developed in 351-1 are applied to the study of such materials-related subjects as electrical properties, optical properties, semiconductor junctions, magnetism, dielectrics, lasers, ferroelectrics, and associated subjects and superconductivity. In all cases, the materials aspect and technological applications of the phenomena are stressed.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Physics 135-1,2,3; Gen Eng 205-4; and Mat Sci 351-1 or equivalent.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Three one-hour lectures with discussion per week. Lab on Thursday for 3 hours per week.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Based on homework, laboratory reports, midterm, final exam, and class participation.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: L. Solymer and D. Walsh, Electrical Properties of Materials, revised edition, Oxford. ISBN: 978-0198702788
